plunden - (10:06): Hi, I have noticed some interesting behaviour in adding objects into templates..  
plunden - (10:07): I have a class which has several properties, first of them is called Date and it is of datatype Date.  
arkub left at 10:08 (Client Quit  
plunden - (10:08): When I add an object of that class into template, for some reason there appears a value in the Date field.  
plunden - (10:09): The value is the date of the moment i added the object into the template.  
plunden - (10:11): In fact, seems that it happens when I add an object of that object in any page.  
plunden - (10:11): I wonder if that 'Date' is a reserved word or something?  
plunden - (10:12): IIRC 'Title' at least is one of such words.  
florinciu left at 10:12 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:14  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 10:15  
Enygma` left at 10:17 (Quit: Leaving.  
plunden1 joined #xwiki at 10:19  
plunden1 left #xwiki at 10:19  
lucaa left #xwiki at 10:25  
glerouge - (10:49): evalica : I looked at the way the logo can be defined from the color theme document, it's good  
glerouge - (10:49): however I feel like the interface is not just quite intuitive enough (having to upload a logo image, then input its name in the logo field)  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:50  
glerouge - (10:50): do you think you could make a proposal to make that just one step instead of 2? or maybe there are technical reasons why it's done like this  
evalica - (10:53): glerouge: the thing is that you may have already the attachment and just want to call it - that input shouldn't be the only place you can upload the logo image  
evalica - (10:56): glerouge: sort of in one step is the way you upload the profile picture  
glerouge - (10:56): yep, but the flow isn't "add attachment - declare as logo", it's more "I want to add a logo - I click around it - I see I have to upload it - I go uplaod it - then I have to go back to the logo part - then I have to input the file name"  
glerouge - (10:57): yep, like the profile picture -> maybe we could add a helper, something like an "uplaod logo" link that would automatically update the prop after the logo file has been updated  
evalica - (10:58): glerouge: depends of the use case - if I have multiple spaces that share a logo, I will want to reuse it . Also if I have multiples color theme that I want to use the same logo, I should be able to reuse it  
arkub joined #xwiki at 10:58  
glerouge - (10:58): right, I didn't think about the different logo per space use case, I didn't even know it was implemented  
glerouge - (10:59): now you can have a different color theme per space ?  
evalica - (10:59): :) don't think is yet implementd :P  
evalica - (11:00): but on incubator there was a version - where you could have colortheme per user  
glerouge - (11:00): ok  
glerouge - (11:00): well, I still think we could make the logo uplaod process a bit better - but you're the UI guru, it's your call ;)

silviar - (13:41): Hi! We have a "Failed to execute macro: html" error when searching for something on 2.3M2  
silviar - (13:41): See issue here http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-636  
silviar - (13:42): I have linked it to http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-632 at Anca's suggestion  
sdumitriu - (13:42): tmortagne: That's your issue  
annacondan joined #xwiki at 13:52  
vmassol - (14:00): restarting myxwiki.org  
nickless left at 14:02 (Ping timeout: 246 seconds  
florinciu left at 14:14 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 14:14  
vmassol - (14:19): tmortagne: have you added the pages you modified to the release notes?  
vmassol - (14:19): (didn't check)  
tmortagne - (14:19): vmassol: that would not make any sense in M2 release note since theses pages are not fixed in M2  
vmassol - (14:19): we need an error block in the RN for 2.3M2  
vmassol - (14:20): and they need to be added in the RN for 2.3RC1  
vmassol - (14:20): (I'd suggest to add them now not to forget them)  
vmassol - (14:20): (I said this the other time and you said you'd do it but in the end I had to do it since I guess you had forgotten)  
vmassol - (14:21): re 2.3M2 we need to mention this refression  
vmassol - (14:21): regression  
tmortagne - (14:21): vmassol: i was not here when the release has been done, i had not forgotten...  
vmassol - (14:21): still  
vmassol - (14:21): it' sbest to prepare the RN as we progress I think  
vmassol - (14:21): less likely to forget anything  
vmassol - (14:22): and forget or not the result was the same  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:22): plunden: Yes, the Date datatype is filled in automatically on save. You can clear the field and it will be set to the current date/time when the doc is saved. If it's filled in though it will stay. I wonder if this is documented...  
vmassol - (14:22): 2.3M2 was released without it in the release notes  
vmassol - (14:22): and I had to rush to add it quickly after 2.3M2 was released  
vmassol - (14:22): took me a long time + I had to check the exact list  
vmassol - (14:23): (if you had done it when you made the modif you'd have had the list ready)  
vmassol - (14:23): ....  
tmortagne - (14:23): sure and yes the regression need to be indicated in the M2 release note has any regression, i was only talking about the list of page to upgrade in the release note that doe snot make sense

Denis - (16:37): jvdrean: Hello, I thought that vote has a duration of 72 hours ? the rules have changed ?  
jvdrean - (16:39): Denis: no, I took some liberty since this vote was quite harmless  
jvdrean - (16:40): Denis: anything against the datepicker addition to contrib ?  
Denis - (16:40): jvdrean: no problem, you had my +0 anyway, but I have a lot of remarks on the date picker, I am preparing a complete answer  
Denis - (16:40): just surprised by the quick closing  
jvdrean - (16:41): Denis: I have remarks too, that's also why I wanted to have it versionned and properly released  
Denis - (16:42): jvdrean: I have more than remark, I have fixes ;)  
jvdrean - (16:42): aah, great :)  
Denis - (16:43): jvdrean: I am just finishing testing under different plateform, and I let you see...
